articles.author: Anne Tergesen and Oyin Adedoyin
articles.title: The 401(k) Investors Convinced That Target-Date Funds Miss the Mark
articles.description: They are the default choice for millions of retirement savers who are automatically enrolled in 401(k) plans. But some investors are moving out of them.
articles.content:
A group of investors are shunning the most popular retirement investment on Wall Street.
Target-date funds are a professionally managed portfolio of stocks and bonds that recalibrates the mix as we … [+6270 chars]

articles.title: Chinese investors dump a record $42.6 billion in U.S. stocks and bonds as the 2024 presidential election nears
articles.description: Sales in the first five months of this year totaled $79.7 billion, an all-time high for the January-May period.

articles.title: Steve Mnuchin calls for a culling of the 20-year Treasury bond he reintroduced
articles.description: “I would not keep issuing them,” Mnuchin, who served as Treasury Secretary under then-President Donald Trump. “It’s just costly to the taxpayer.”
